overview_summary: None of the five profiled neighbors have taken a documented public stance on local development or clean energy projects. All are classified as having an unknown position due to lack of explicit statements. Community influence appears limited – none are current officials or outspoken civic leaders, with any local sway coming mostly from their status as landowners rather than formal roles.

neighbors.name: Arne & Elizabeth Thompson
neighbors.claims: Arne and Elizabeth Thompson own multiple agricultural parcels in the Town of Dallas, Barron County ([sfs.dpi.wi.gov](https://sfs.dpi.wi.gov/safr_ro/tax_apportionment_all_districts.asp?year=2015#:~:text=Barron%2003%20028%20T,00)). They have no recorded involvement in local government or public comments on development, indicating a low public profile ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/655167150-did-farm-subsidies-in-cities-associated-with-barron-county-rise-or-fall-in-2021#:~:text=Orin%20J.%20Thompson%20%20,49.2)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected neighboring farmer or community elder reach out, emphasizing how the project can coexist with farming traditions and preserve rural heritage.

neighbors.name: Charles G & Renee M Rihn
neighbors.claims: Charles G. Rihn is part of a multi-generation farming family; records show a Melvin C. Rihn farming in the Bloomer area since the 1940s ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/leadertelegram/name/denese-rihn-obituary?id=9707238#:~:text=Bloomer%20Denese%20E,grandchildren%2C%20other%20relatives%20and%20friends)). Charles and Renee Rihn themselves do not appear in Barron County meeting minutes or local news reports, suggesting no active public profile ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/655167150-did-farm-subsidies-in-cities-associated-with-barron-county-rise-or-fall-in-2021#:~:text=No%20,rihn)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-town farm owners; no local roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via a mutual farming community contact (possibly through Bloomer area networks) to reassure them that the project will not diminish their land’s agricultural value or use.

neighbors.name: Not Available
neighbors.claims: Barron County’s land records list the owner of parcel 020350008000 as “Not Available,” indicating no individual name on record ([www.usvotefoundation.org](https://www.usvotefoundation.org/town-of-dallas-barron-county-wi-election-office#:~:text=Town%20of%20Dallas%2C%20Barron%20County%2C,contact%20information%20for%20the%20election)). Without an identified owner, there is no public background or stated position to assess for this parcel ([www.usvotefoundation.org](https://www.usvotefoundation.org/town-of-dallas-barron-county-wi-election-office#:~:text=Town%20of%20Dallas%2C%20Barron%20County%2C,contact%20information%20for%20the%20election)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Work through county channels or nearby landowners to locate and engage this owner once their identity is known, addressing any concerns with transparency.

neighbors.name: Tyler J Graetz
neighbors.claims: A wedding announcement shows Tyler J. Graetz planning a marriage in August 2024 in nearby Cadott, Wisconsin ([www.zola.com](https://www.zola.com/wedding/sikoragraetzwedding#:~:text=Jessica%20Sikora%20and%20Tyler%20Graetz%27s,ZOLA)). Beyond that personal note, no public records or media references tie Graetz to any civic activities or opinions on local development ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/569167773-who-were-the-indefinitely-confined-voters-in-barron-county#:~:text=No%20,graetz)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach informally through a peer in his age group or community circle to discuss any concerns about noise or property impacts, highlighting the project’s minimal disruption to his plans.

neighbors.name: Travis & Jolene Lentz
neighbors.claims: Travis J. Lentz is a prominent local farmer, receiving $79,103 in federal farm subsidies in 2020 alone ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/655167150-did-farm-subsidies-in-cities-associated-with-barron-county-rise-or-fall-in-2021#:~:text=Dairyland%20Trucking%2C%20LLC%20%20,12.9)). Neither Travis nor Jolene Lentz has a record of speaking at public hearings or in news on development issues ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/569167773-who-were-the-indefinitely-confined-voters-in-barron-county#:~:text=Freida%20Agusta%20Lentz%20%20,09%2F19%2F2020)), suggesting they have not taken a public stance in such debates.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage them via local agricultural leaders or the county extension agent, focusing on how the project will protect soil/drainage and not impede farm operations or road access.
